title: Elvis Džafić
text:
Elvis Džafić (born 19 December 1990) is a Slovenian professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a> who plays for <a href="ND%20Ilirija%201911">Ilirija 1911</a>.
Besides Slovenia, he has also played in Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Club career.
Early career.
Džafić started off his career at hometown club <a href="NK%20Svoboda%20Ljubljana">Svoboda Ljubljana</a> where he played for the youth team and later on for the seniors as well.
Olimpija Ljubljana.
In 2010, Džafić signed with <a href="Slovenian%20PrvaLiga">Slovenian PrvaLiga</a> club <a href="NK%20Olimpija%20Ljubljana">Olimpija Ljubljana</a>. He made 64 league appearances for Olimpija in the rowspan of four seasons, the most being in the <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20Slovenian%20PrvaLiga">2011–12 season</a> making 33 league appearances. He left Olimpija in 2014.
Triglav.
After leaving Olimpija, Džafić signed with <a href="NK%20Triglav%20Kranj">Triglav Kranj</a>, who back then played in the <a href="Slovenian%20Second%20League">Slovenian Second League</a>. He won the <a href="2016%E2%80%9317%20Slovenian%20Second%20League">2016–17 Slovenian Second League</a> with Triglav and gained promotion to the <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20Slovenian%20PrvaLiga">2017–18 Slovenian PrvaLiga</a>.
He made 80 league appearances for Triglav, being a first team regular for the whole time. He left Triglav in 2018.
Sarajevo.
On 17 August 2018, Džafić signed a contract with <a href="Premier%20League%20of%20Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">Bosnian Premier League</a> club <a href="FK%20Sarajevo">Sarajevo</a>. He made his official debut for Sarajevo on 19 September 2018 in a 1–0 away win in the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina%20Football%20Cup%23First%20round">first round</a> of the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina%20Football%20Cup">2018–19 Bosnian Cup</a> against <a href="FK%20Vele%C5%BE%20Mostar">Velež Mostar</a>.
In the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20FK%20Sarajevo%20season">2018–19</a> season, Džafić won the double with Sarajevo after winning both the <a href="Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina%20Football%20Cup">Bosnian Cup</a> and the Premier League. He made his first league appearance for Sarajevo in a 2–1 away league win against Velež Mostar on 23 November 2019.
Džafić won his second league title with the club on 1 June 2020, though after the <a href="2019%E2%80%9320%20Premier%20League%20of%20Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">2019–20 Bosnian Premier League</a> season was ended abruptly due to the <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic%20in%20Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">COVID-19 pandemic in Bosnia and Herzegovina</a> and after which Sarajevo were by default crowned league champions for a second consecutive time.
On 17 June 2020, he extended his contract with Sarajevo until June 2021. Džafić left Sarajevo after his contract with the club expired in June 2021.
International career.
Džafić made two appearances for the <a href="Slovenia%20national%20under-21%20football%20team">Slovenian under-21 team</a> in 2012.
Personal life.
Džafić's family is from Bosnia and Herzegovina. His father is from <a href="Novi%20Grad%2C%20Republika%20Srpska">Bosanski Novi</a> and his mother is from <a href="Klju%C4%8D%2C%20Una-Sana%20Canton">Ključ</a>.
Honours.
Triglav Kranj
Sarajevo
